Materials: You require a jade circlet worth at least 1,500 gp, which you must place on your head before casting.

Utility

This spell has no effect if you attempt to transform into a &reference[Construct], an &reference[Undead], or a creature you have not seen before.

  • You assume the form of a creature with a CR up to your level. You become an average specimen of that creature (no class levels, no Spellcasting trait).

  • Statistics: Replace your statistics with those of the new form. Retain your alignment, &reference[Intelligence], &reference[Wisdom], and &reference[Charisma]. Keep your saving throw and skill proficiencies, and gain those of the new form (using the higher value if both overlap).

  • Hit Points: You assume the new form’s Hit Points and Hit Dice. When you revert, you return to the HP you had before. If reduced to 0 HP, excess damage carries over to your original form; you aren’t &reference[Unconscious] unless that also reduces your original form to 0 HP.

  • Actions: You cannot use legendary actions or lair actions of the new form.

  • Features: You retain class, race, and other features if your new form can physically use them. You cannot use special senses you have (e.g. &reference[Darkvision]) unless the form also has them. You can only speak if the new form can speak.

  • Equipment: Choose whether equipment (a) falls to the ground, (b) merges with your form (inactive), or (c) is worn if practical. Equipment does not resize.

  • Changing Form: During the spell’s duration, you may use your Action to assume another eligible form. If the new form has higher HP than your current total, your HP remain unchanged.
